description: Coordinates group travel logistics, calculates optimal meeting points, and manages shared commute planning for students

meeting_point.why_optimal: Bandra is centrally accessible for participants coming from Borivali (Western Line), Andheri (Western Line), and Thane (Trans-Harbour/Western via Kanjurmarg-Vikhroli or Kurla). The main entrance makes an easy and visible meetup spot with seating nearby.

shared_route.route_details: All participants arrive at Bandra Station; regroup and share a rickshaw, cab, or walk together to a nearby café (if desired).

to_meeting_point.route: Direct Western Line local train to Bandra, 11 stations, then 2-minute walk to main entrance
Central Line to Kurla, then Harbour Line to Bandra (or Central to Dadar, then switch to Western Line to Bandra)
Western Line local train to Bandra, 4 stations, then 2-minute walk to main entrance

coordination_suggestions.suggestion: Since Thane's route may take the longest, Borivali and Andheri friends can plan to take slightly later trains for a more synchronized arrival.
coordination_suggestions.benefits: No one needs to wait too long; group arrives together.

coordination_suggestions.suggestion: If continuing to a café or event post-meetup, consider sharing a cab/rickshaw from Bandra Station and splitting the cost equally.
coordination_suggestions.benefits: Fair, economical, and social travel to next destination.

social_opportunities.activity: Quick hangout at ‘The Bagel Shop’ café near Bandra Station
suitable_for: All participants arriving early or on time
Anyone waiting for the full group
